ARABIC: أَفَمَنْ حَقَّ عَلَيْهِ كَلِمَةُ ٱلْعَذَابِ أَفَأَنتَ تُنقِذُ مَن فِى ٱلنَّارِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But as for those against whom the decree of Punishment is justly carried out, can you rescue those who are in the Fire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Can he against whom the sentence of punishment has been justified (be rescued)? Can you save him who is in the Fire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (O Prophet), can you save him (from chastisement) against whom the sentence of chastisement has become due; him who has, (as it were), already fallen into the Fire?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: How can you rescue the one who is destined to suffer the torment?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So will the one upon whom the Word of punishment has proved true, ever be equal to those who are forgiven? So will you guide and save the one who deserves the fire? (Because the hearts of some disbelievers are sealed).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Is, then one against whom the Word of punishment is justified (equal to the one who avoids evil) Will you rescue him who is in the Fire
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: What! as for him then against whom the sentence of chastisement is due: What! can you save him who is in the fire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: He against whom the word of chastisement is realized -- shalt thou deliver him out of the Fire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Is he on whom the word of doom is fulfilled (to be helped), and canst thou (O Muhammad) rescue him who is in the Fire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But what of him against whom the sentence of punishment is justified? Can you rescue one who is already in the Fire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Is he then on whom is justified the decree of torment - wilt thou rescue him who is in the Fire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Can he against whom the word of punishment has become due…? Can you rescue someone who is in the Fire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Is, then, one against whom the decree of Punishment is justly due (equal to one who eschews Evil)? Wouldst thou, then, deliver one (who is) in the Fire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Is, then one against whom the Word of punishment justified (equal to the one who avoids evil). Will you (O Muhammad SAW) rescue him who is in the Fire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Can you save from the Fire he whom against the word of punishment has been realized?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: What about someone who has deserved the sentence of punishment? Is it you who can save those in the Fire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then, is one who has deserved the decree of punishment [to be guided]? Then, can you save one who is in the Fire?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [39:19] Can he against whom the word of chastisement has been fulfilled …?, namely [the words], I will surely fill Hell [with jinn and mankind together] [Q. 11:119]; Will you deliver, bring out, one who is in the Fire? (this is the response to the conditional clause, in which the overt qualification [man fī’l-nār, ‘one who is in the Fire’] replaces the pronominalisation [a-fa-man, ‘he … whom’]; the hamza [in a-fa-anta, ‘will you’] is for rejection, in other words [the sense is that] you will not be able to guide him and therefore deliver him from the Fire).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Is he on whom the word of doom is fulfilled) is the one upon whom the doom is decreed, i.e. Abu Jahl and his host, (and canst thou (0 Muhammad) rescue him who is in the Fire) he upon whom the Fire is decreed?
